executive_summary.case: HS-FEMA-02430-2024 - Max J. Meindl vs FEMA Region 6
key_findings: Maximum RA Delay: 1,195 days (2,566% over 45-day policy)
HIPAA Violations: PHI exposed via unencrypted email
Retaliation: Termination 17 days after EEO complaint
Age Discrimination: Pattern of disparate treatment at age 74

timeline_data.event: Meindl files harassment complaint (HS-FEMA-01876). Closed without investigation on Oct 15, 2018, signaling early neglect.
violations: MD-110 §III.A: Failure to investigate harassment complaint undermines EEO process integrity
timeline_data.quotes: No direct quotes available; event referenced in Comprehensive Response, p. 3.

timeline_data.event: Meindl submits RA request (RAR001234) for episodic telework. Denied by Jamie McAllister on Dec 10, 2018, without discussion.
violations: Rehabilitation Act §501: Denial without interactive process violates 29 C.F.R. §1630.2(o)(3)
MD-110 §VI.A: Lack of engagement breaches RA process
timeline_data.quotes: No direct quotes available; denial noted in Comprehensive Response, p. 3.

timeline_data.event: FMLA request approved effective May 1, 2019, for 12 weeks due to chronic health condition.
violations: None identified for approval, but sets context for RA needs
timeline_data.quotes: Your request for FMLA leave has been approved effective May 1, 2019, for 12 weeks.

timeline_data.event: Meindl requests FMLA recertification, feeling 'singled out' as a senior citizen (age 74).
violations: ADEA (29 U.S.C. §623): Perception of age-based scrutiny suggests discrimination
timeline_data.quotes: I feel singled out as a senior citizen in this process.

timeline_data.event: Meindl expresses COVID-19 exposure concerns (COPD, CAD), considering 2–6 week RA for telework. Keya Jackson provides RA Fact Sheet, requiring redundant documentation.
violations: MD-110 §VI.C: Redundant documentation violates streamlined process
Rehabilitation Act §501: Delay risks timely accommodation
timeline_data.quotes: Meindl: 'Given my COPD and CAD, I'm concerned about COVID-19 exposure.' Jackson: 'Please submit FEMA Form 256 with a doctor's note.'

timeline_data.event: RAs (RAR0023025, RAR0023278) submitted, unresolved for 1,195 days.
violations: FEMA Instruction 256-022-01: 1,195-day delay violates 45-day policy
MD-110 §IV.D: Exceeds 180-day timeline
Rehabilitation Act §501: Non-adjudication
timeline_data.quotes: No direct quotes available; delay noted in Comprehensive Response, p. 3.

timeline_data.event: Meindl suffers heart attack, notifies Richard Cain.
violations: None identified, but highlights health vulnerabilities ignored
timeline_data.quotes: Will be off this week… heart attack recovery.

timeline_data.event: RA (RAR0042452) for permanent telework; Mark Underhill endorses as 'reasonable.' Ignored for 886 days.
violations: FEMA Instruction 256-022-01: 886-day delay violates 45-day policy
MD-110 §VI.A: Ignoring endorsement breaches interactive process

timeline_data.event: RA (RAR0046767) for permanent telework submitted via ACMS; not assigned until Jun 12, 2024 (163-day delay).
violations: FEMA Instruction 256-022-01: 163-day delay violates 45-day policy
MD-110 §IV.D: Exceeds 180-day timeline
timeline_data.quotes: No direct quotes available; submission noted in PERPLEXITY SUMMARY-APRIL 2025.docx, p. 4.

timeline_data.event: Meindl to Brasher: 'RA requests never get adjudicated'; Brasher offers discussion via Colleen Sciano.
violations: MD-110 §VI.A: Failure to act on non-adjudication complaint delays interactive process
timeline_data.quotes: Meindl: 'The RA requests never get adjudicated.' Brasher: 'Let's discuss through Colleen Sciano.'

timeline_data.event: Brasher assigns RAR0046767 to Shelia Clemons for 'expedited processing' after 194 days, admitting FEMA is 'very far behind.' Clemons sends unencrypted email exposing COPD/CAD.
violations: FEMA Instruction 256-022-01: 194-day delay violates 45-day policy
HIPAA (45 CFR §164.312): Unencrypted email breaches PHI security
MD-110 §VI.C: Redundant request violates streamlined process
timeline_data.quotes: Clemons: 'We acknowledge unavoidable delay... please provide PD & medical docs.' Meindl: 'I've already uploaded these to ACMS.'

timeline_data.event: Anthony In denies RAR0046767, claiming deployment as 'essential function,' ignoring 38-month remote success.
violations: Rehabilitation Act §501: Denial without assessment violates 29 C.F.R. §1630.2(n)(3)
MD-110 §VI.A: Failure to document feasibility breaches process
ADEA (29 U.S.C. §623): Disparate treatment suggests age bias

timeline_data.event: Meindl messages Brasher about RA denial and job loss fears; she promises follow-up but takes no action.
violations: MD-110 §XI: Inaction risks retaliation
Rehabilitation Act §501: Failure to resolve RA violates 29 C.F.R. §1630
timeline_data.quotes: Meindl: 'I'm worried about job loss due to RA denial.' Brasher: 'I'll follow up.'

timeline_data.event: Meindl files EEO complaint (HS-FEMA-02430-2024) alleging disability, age discrimination, retaliation.
violations: None identified; protected activity under 29 C.F.R. §1614
timeline_data.quotes: No direct quotes available; filing noted in PERPLEXITY SUMMARY-APRIL 2025.docx, p. 14.

timeline_data.event: FEMA terminates Meindl, citing 'medical inability,' during Brasher's tenure, without prior warnings or 30-day notice.
violations: Rehabilitation Act §501: Termination without accommodations violates 42 U.S.C. §12112(b)(5)(A)
MD-110 §XI: 17-day proximity suggests retaliation
5 U.S.C. §7513: No 30-day notice
FEMA Manual 123-13-1: No progressive discipline or Douglas Factors
ADEA (29 U.S.C. §623): Age-based termination likely
timeline_data.quotes: Terminated due to medical inability to perform essential functions.

delay_analysis.event: RAs (RAR0023025, RAR0023278) submitted, unresolved for 1,195 days.
RA (RAR0042452) for permanent telework; Mark Underhill endorses as 'reasonable.' Ignored for 886 days.
RA (RAR0046767) for permanent telework submitted via ACMS; not assigned until Jun 12, 2024 (163-day delay).
Brasher assigns RAR0046767 to Shelia Clemons for 'expedited processing' after 194 days, admitting FEMA is 'very far behind.' Clemons sends unencrypted email exposing COPD/CAD.

patterns.evidence: Termination 17 days after EEO complaint filed
Multiple references to age (74), 'singled out as senior citizen'
